summary: Colorectal cancer is a type of cancer that develops in the tissues of the colon or rectum, which are parts of the large intestine. It is characterized by the uncontrolled growth of cells, often originating from benign polyps, which can then invade and spread to other parts of the body.
causes: Mutations in the Wnt signaling pathway
Mutations in AXIN1, AXIN2, TCF7L2, NKD1 genes
Deactivation of TGF-β and DCC proteins
Mutations in KRAS, RAF, PI3K genes
Mutations in PTEN tumor suppressor gene
Mutations in FAM123B, SOX9, ATM, ARID1A genes (non-hypermutated tumors)
Mutations in ACVR2A, TGFBR2, MSH3, MSH6, SLC9A9, BRAF genes (hypermutated tumors)
Epigenetic alterations (e.g., abnormal DNA methylation, altered microRNA expression, histone modifications)
Epigenetic reductions of DNA repair enzyme expression
Enrichment of Clostridia and other pro-inflammatory taxa
risk_factors: Genetic syndromes (e.g., Familial Adenomatous Polyposis (FAP), Lynch syndrome, Gardner syndrome, Serrated Polyposis Syndrome)
Inflammatory bowel disease (e.g., chronic ulcerative colitis, Crohn disease)
High alcohol consumption (three or more drinks/day)
Diet high in red meat, processed meat, saturated fats, sugar
Elevated fecal bile acids (e.g., deoxycholic acid, cholic acid, chenodeoxycholic acid)
Ashkenazi Jewish ethnicity (due to APC gene mutations)
symptoms: Change in bowel habits (diarrhea, constipation, narrower stool)
Blood in the stool (bright red or very dark)
diagnosis: Stool tests (e.g., Fecal occult blood testing (FOBT), Fecal immunochemical test (FIT), FIT-DNA)
Medical imaging (e.g., CT scan, PET scan, MRI)
treatments: Surgery (e.g., endoscopic resection, partial colectomy, proctocolectomy, radiofrequency ablation, cryosurgery, removal of metastases, cytoreductive surgery, intestinal bypass, stent placement)
Chemotherapy (e.g., Fluorouracil (5-FU), Capecitabine, Oxaliplatin, Irinotecan, UFT, CAPOX, FOLFOX, FOLFOXIRI, FOLFIRI regimens)
Targeted therapy (e.g., Bevacizumab, Aflibercept, Cetuximab, Panitumumab)
Immunotherapy (e.g., immune checkpoint inhibitors, Pembrolizumab, Dostarlimab)
Psychosocial interventions (e.g., talk therapy, support groups)
